text:
The National Investigation Agency, which is probing the Pathankot terror attack, on Thursday conducted searches at five places, including the office and houses of Punjab SP Salwinder Singh and his friends.

Mr. Singh’s residences in Amritsar and Gurdaspur were searched; so were his Gurdaspur office and the residence of his jeweller-friend Rajesh Verma, whose throat was slit allegedly by the terrorists after they kidnapped them along with a cook. Sleuths also searched the homes of cook Madan Gopal and a woman friend of Mr. Singh and the jeweller.

The searches came after Mr. Singh was questioned for several days in Delhi. On Wednesday, a lie detector test was conducted on him as part of the probe into the attack on the airbase. Mr. Singh is posted as Assistant Commandant of 75th Punjab Armed Police after he was shunted out as Superintendent of Police (Headquarters), Gurdaspur.

The NIA is questioning him to ascertain the sequence of events after he was allegedly kidnapped on the intervening night of December 31 and January 1 by Jaish-e-Mohammed terrorists. — PTI
title: NIA searches police officer’s residence
